body_html:
When you mean 'Conda version' do you mean conda install -c caffe2 caffe2 or scripts/build_anaconda.sh ?

Whenever I see "unicode" in a Python error string, I immediately think of a Python 2-3 mismatch. Does conda install -c caffe2 caffe2 in a Python 3.6 environment work?
body_text:
When you mean 'Conda version' do you mean conda install -c caffe2 caffe2 or scripts/build_anaconda.sh ?
Whenever I see "unicode" in a Python error string, I immediately think of a Python 2-3 mismatch. Does conda install -c caffe2 caffe2 in a Python 3.6 environment work?
body:
When you mean 'Conda version' do you mean `conda install -c caffe2 caffe2` or `scripts/build_anaconda.sh` ?

Whenever I see "unicode" in a Python error string, I immediately think of a Python 2-3 mismatch. Does `conda install -c caffe2 caffe2` in a Python 3.6 environment work?
